channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Banging drain cover., 22nd February
item.description:
The drain cover is banging when vehicles go over it. The street has night buses, Stoke Newington Church Street.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Church Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Insufficient crossing type, 22nd February
item.description:
Today my dog was killed and nearly my sons life was lost due to the crossing at north cray rd ,my son had pressed for the crossing , and as there is no sound or light signal my son waited for longer then he should and the near side car stopped but the time had elapsed when my son crossed and the far side car continued running over and killing our dog this could of been my son , I reported this crossing over a year ago .what has to happen for the crossing to be made safe ???
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North Cray Road, North Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Datchelor Place is not a bike shed. It is a space for pedestrians. Remove it now, 22nd February
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Datchelor Place, Camberwell, Greater London

item.title: Toilets and junk dumped in the street, 22nd February
item.description:
All along Manor Road, Stoke Newington, there's a huge problem with fly tipping. The problem starts from 58 Manor Road. People are dumbing fridges, cookers, household rubbish, and more. In the last three weeks I've seen three toilets just dumbed in the stre

item.title: Repair on road cobbles poorly finished, 22nd February
item.description:
The road was repaired about a month ago (possibly Conway contractor). They have made non effort to put the cobbles back in the same way they took them up so the yellow and white road markings are all over the place. Was this work not checked? Or are they coming back to finish the job?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 78, Edmund Street, Camberwell, Greater London
